text:
The Magnus Archives – MAG037 – Burnt Offering 
1 
 
MAG – 037 – Burnt Offering 
Content Warnings 
− Burns 
− Fire 
− Graphic injury 
− Suicide 
− Discussions of: Death, human remains, animal remains 
− Mentions of: Torture 
 
[The Magnus Archives Theme - Intro] 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Rusty Quill Presents The Magnus Archives Episode Thirty Seven Burnt Offering 
 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Intro - Continues] 
 
[CLICK] 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Tell me again. 
 
MARTIN 
Again? 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
I want it on tape. 
 
MARTIN 
What? Why 

The Magnus Archives – MAG037 – Burnt Offering 
2 
 
 
 JONATHAN SIMS 
I just want a record. To make sure I have something I can check. 
 
MARTIN 
Okay, fine. There were two delivery men. They were big, and they spoke with 
cockney accents that might have been fake, and they delivered a package for 
you. I don’t remember anything else about what they looked like. 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Nothing at all? 
 
MARTIN 
They looked normal. Like you’d expect. They looked like two, huge, cockney 
delivery men. I don’t know what else you want? 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
What about the table? 
 
MARTIN 
I didn’t see the table. I guess Rosie must have signed for it. I mean, it’s her 
office on the way to Artefact Storage, that makes sense. 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
She says the same as you. Two men, doesn’t know how they got in, too 
intimidated to ask, looked “exactly like you’d expect”. Useless... 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG037 – Burnt Offering 
3 
 
MARTIN 
Sorry... Look, John, I do think we should destroy the table, though. I mean, if 
it’s the one from Amy Patel’s statement. Just in case. 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Elias told me the same thing. Luckily he phrased it as advice rather than an 
instruction, so for now I’m more inclined to keep studying it. We’re not in the 
business of destroying knowledge. 
 
MARTIN 
I suppose. Can I go now? 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Yes, go on. 
 
MARTIN 
Thank you. 
 
[DOOR OPENS] 
MARTIN 
Look, you need to get some sleep. … I’ll see you later. 
 
[DOOR CLOSES] 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Waste of tape, really. He’s right. Might as well get some use out of it. 
Statement of Jason North, regarding the discovery of an alleged ritual site 

The Magnus Archives – MAG037 – Burnt Offering 
4 
 
found near Loch Glass in Scotland. Original statement given August 6th 2009. 
Audio recording by Jonathan Sims, Head Archivist of the Magnus Institute, 
London. 
Statement begins. 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
(Read a loud from the archived witness statement of Jason North) 
I just need to know if you can save my son. I’ve asked and asked and your 
people only ever tell me to write my statement. Put it down on paper for 
investigation. Is that going to help? No. Of course it isn’t. Even if you had the 
power to do something, would you? Or would you rather watch my son burn 
so you can take notes. 
I’ve been drinking. You can probably tell from the stains. Well, I don’t plan to 
apologise for ruining your precious paper, and I don’t plan to stop. Only way to 
keep the fear from settling in. If I’m scared I’m going to lose Ethan like I lost 
everything else, then I’ll curl into a ball and never get up. I won’t be able to do 
anything to stop it. I won’t let my son burn, even if you cowards don’t have the 
guts to step up and do something. 
I’m sorry. I know. There’s no-one to blame by my own stupid self. Blundering in 
where I had no right to go. But yes, I know, you want the whole goddamn 
story, don’t you? So you can look over it in ten years and go “Hmm, 
interesting” long after Ethan and me are dead. Well, fine. There’s not much to 
it, really. For everything it’s done to me, I didn’t really do anything at all. Just 
messed around in the wrong clearing. 
I’m an ecologist. Was an ecologist. Working for the Forestry Commission up in 
Scotland. It was a great job. For me, at least. I suppose if you don’t like hiking
